HubSpot, a market leader in sales and marketing technology, is the preferred platform for scaling businesses. The Finance Data team's Advanced Analytics and Insights (AAI) group is pioneering the use of machine learning, large language models (LLMs), and intelligent agents to unlock high-impact financial insights. As we grow, we're seeking an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer to build out the foundational AI and ML systems that support complex AI needs from forecasting, smart insights to finance-focused copilots.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer (MLE) on the newly formed Finance AAI team, you'll build production-grade machine learning systems, deploy LLM-powered tools, and set up the ML infrastructure that supports financial forecasting, risk analysis, and AI-driven insights.. This is a role for builders: engineers who love solving complex problems and enabling business impact through smart automation. Strong coding skills in Python, ML, Gen-AI domains are very essential. Experience with Java is a strong plus that will help navigate our internal systems.

Responsibilities & Role Expectations
Collaborate with data scientists to deploy and maintain machine learning models for forecasting, anomaly detection, NLP analysis and customer outcome prediction. Take ownership of the full development lifecycle : including development, CI/CD pipelines, containerization, orchestration, and performance monitoring with tools like MLflow.
Build a strong foundation of scalable and reusable infrastructure to support Finance's ML/AI experimentation. Contribute SDKs, APIs, and clear documentation to streamline ML/LLM adoption and provide shared services in line with the Finance AAI's roadmap.
Design and implement LLM-driven workflows and autonomous agents tailored to Finance use cases such as narrative generation, AI copilots, and RAG-based insights. Apply techniques like prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and embedding search using open-source libraries including LangChain, Hugging Face, and OpenAI APIs. Confidently validate model performance using standard benchmarks and custom metrics.
Champion strong engineering practices through mentorship and technical guidance, ensuring systems are aligned with data governance and regulatory standards. Collaborate with central teams at Hubspot to enable ML/AI best practices
Engage in code reviews, testing, and documentation efforts to uphold code quality and maintainability. Mentor junior engineers and data scientists to strengthen their software development skills, optimize algorithms, and stay current with advancements in the field.
About You
Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
Expert knowledge of machine learning and AI techniques, with a strong track record of selecting appropriate methods and successfully deploying multiple models in production, including full lifecycle ownership, development, CI/CD, monitoring, and maintenance
Strong Python & SQL skills with deep experience in ML/AI libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, CrewAI and LangChain.
Hands-on experience with LLM deployment (workflows & agents), vector search, and RAG pipelines at scale.
Familiarity with Java is a big plus, especially for internal service integration.
Knowledgeable in model monitoring, alerting, and evaluation techniques.
Proficient developing & working with API's & standard ML deployment stack: Git, Docker, Kubernetes, FastAPI, etc.
Capable of independently leading ML/AI projects from concept to production.
Excellent communicator, able to translate complex technical ideas to diverse audiences. Collaborative and creative, thrives in fast-paced, iterative environments.

Bonus Points

Familiarity with React framework, and RPC functions to expose back-end systems to front-end clients.
Experience working with Kafka or other stream based processing architecture.
Familiarity with emerging LLM architectures and techniques in LLM space like Graph RAG, MCP, A2A, Long/Short term memory.



Cash compensation range: 136000-204000 USD Annually

Join our dynamic team as we scale our cutting-edge trading solutions. We’re seeking an experienced Data Scientist/Machine Learning Expert with big tech experience to drive our Expert Advisor (EA) development for all major trading platforms, with a strong focus on Python and API integrations. As a key benefit, you’ll have the opportunity to invest in our trading fund, aligning your financial success with our innovative strategies. We offer a competitive sign-on bonus.

Core Functions

Code Analysis & Optimization: Analyze and enhance existing code for Expert Advisors to improve performance and reliability on all major trading platforms.
Machine Learning (ML) Integration: Develop and integrate predictive ML models into EAs, leveraging Python and APIs to advance trading strategies.
Development & Testing: Build, test, and deploy EA features, ensuring robust performance across diverse market conditions.

Analyze codebases to understand functionality and identify optimization opportunities.
Write, refactor, and test code in Python, and C++ to implement EA enhancements and fixes, with a primary focus on Python-based solutions.
Develop and integrate machine learning models (e.g., using TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn) into EAs.
Conduct rigorous backtesting and forward testing to validate EA performance and reliability.
Collaborate with traders to align EA functionality with trading objectives.
Maintain detailed documentation of code changes, optimizations, and integration processes.
Monitor real-time EA operations, troubleshoot issues, and deploy updates as needed.
Review code for security, efficiency, and adherence to algorithmic trading best practices.
Participate in team meetings to prioritize tasks and provide progress updates.
Continuously learn and stay updated on all major trading platform updates, MQL advancements, TradingView/PineScript developments, and ML techniques.
Contribute to a high-energy team culture, supporting shared goals and innovation.

QualificationsMust Haves

Strong proficiency in Python, with expertise in machine learning model development (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn) and API integrations.
Expertise in C++ for low-level optimizations and DLL integrations in all major trading platforms.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent professional experience. Doctorate preferred.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Willingness to relocate to San Juan, Puerto Rico, for a full-time position.
Fluent in English for verbal and written communication.

Nice to Haves

Experience with machine learning in finance or algorithmic trading (e.g., predictive modeling, LSTMs).
Familiarity with additional tools/languages (e.g., R, MATLAB, Java) for data analysis.
Knowledge of financial markets, trading strategies, or forex regulatory compliance.
Proficiency with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile methodologies.
Certifications in machine learning or MetaTrader-specific training.

Why Join Us?

Access to our Fund: The unique opportunity to invest directly in our trading fund (exclusive for employees only, similar to Renaissance Technologies LLC), aligning your financial growth with the success of our innovative strategies.
Sign-On Bonus: Receive a competitive sign-on bonus with minimum time commitment.
Tax Advantages: Benefit from Puerto Rico’s Act 60 incentives.
Impactful Role: Apply your big tech experience to shape cutting-edge trading algorithms in a fast-growing fintech environment.
Collaborative Culture: Join an international, high-energy team with opportunities for growth and hands-on training.

Description

Precision Neuroscience is pioneering a brain implant, known as a brain-computer interface (BCI), to restore communication and independence for people with neurological conditions. Our cutting-edge technology is designed to empower people with paralysis to control digital devices—such as computers and smartphones—with their thoughts alone, opening new possibilities for daily life.
Precision’s multidisciplinary team brings together leading experts in diverse fields such as neurosurgery, artificial intelligence, machine learning, microfabrication, electrical engineering, and more. We are committed to turning breakthrough scientific advancements into real-world solutions for people affected by conditions such as spinal cord injury, stroke, and ALS.

As a Precision employee, you will be joining one of the fastest moving and best-capitalized companies in the emerging field of BCI. Since our founding in 2021, Precision has secured over $155 million in funding, developed and validated our technology, and initiated human trials in collaboration with some of the nation’s top hospitals.

We are seeking a Product Manager of Machine Learning to drive the execution of our machine learning initiatives. This individual will partner closely with our ML lead and cross-functional teams to plan, prioritize, and deliver ML-driven features and capabilities.

In this role you will own the day-to-day product management of the ML team – breaking down complex initiatives into actionable plans, defining clear requirements and success metrics, and ensuring timely execution of work that supports our clinical programs and next-generation product roadmap. This is a unique opportunity to shape groundbreaking brain–computer interface technology that will directly impact the lives of people living with severe neurological conditions.

This position will be based in our Manhattan or Santa Clara office. We are unable to consider remote workers or people not currently based in the United States, with working rights.

Key Responsibilities


ML Team Planning & Execution: Own the day-to-day planning and management of the ML team’s work, including backlog generation, refinement, and sprint planning.

Requirements Definition: Collaborate closely with the ML lead and cross-functional stakeholders (clinical, UX, hardware, software, and other PMs) to gather, define, and document detailed ML requirements and success metrics.

Implementation & Acceptance Criteria: Partner with UX research and design to define implementation details and acceptance criteria for ML-driven features, ensuring user-centered outcomes.

Work Breakdown: Break down complex ML initiatives into epics and user stories to drive efficient development cycles.

Clinical Collaboration: Partner with the clinical team to ensure the ML team has the data and patient enrollment necessary for model development and validation. Support IONM and EONM case planning, goal-setting, and learnings capture.

Cross-functional Coordination: Ensure seamless communication between the ML team and other departments, including regulatory, quality, UX, and software engineering.


Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

3+ years of experience in product management, ideally with a strong focus on machine learning or AI-driven products.

Proven experience in Agile development, including sprint planning, backlog management, and epic/story creation. Solid understanding of machine learning concepts, methodologies, and data pipelines. Strong track record working with cross-functional teams including ML engineers, data scientists, UX designers, and clinical professionals. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
Experience in healthcare, neuroscience, or a related field is a plus.
